html:
Samsung prepares to launch its most affordable buds in the Galaxy lineup, the Galaxy Buds Core. They are expected to hit the Indian market on June 27, and the company has quietly or accidentally jumped the gun and revealed some of the key features on its UAE website.

Despite being the cheapest in the lineup, the Galaxy Buds Core will offer active noise cancellation, just like the Galaxy Buds FE and the Buds 3 Pro. Additionally, they boast the longest battery life in the Galaxy Buds family with an advertised 35 hours of continuous music playback without ANC. ANC will reduce battery life significantly.

The pair packs a 65 mAh battery each with a 500 mAh rechargeable case. The supported audio codecs are AAC, SBC and SSC over Bluetooth 5.4 connection.

This is an impressive set of features for the cheapest Galaxy Buds, and we will know more about them by tomorrow.
